title: Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield mortified by 'sinister' This Morning competition

This Morning hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield were left a little stunned by the "harsh" competition segment on Monday morning.

Love Island 2019 favourite Maura Higgins hosted the clips throughout the episode, giving viewers a chance to win a money prize and a car.

It was a Halloween themed clip with scary music, while Maura walked through dark woodlands as creepy noises could be heard.

In the second competition clip of the day things took a sinister turn, when Maura received a chilling phone call.

(Image: ITV)

The man on the other end of the phone issued a deadly threat, and hosts Holly and Phil were caught off guard when the show returned to the studio live on air.

As Maura encouraged viewers to enter the competition, the voice on the phone told her: "Hello Maura. People better get entering Maura, or you'll be gutted."

Maura looked super confused as she stared at her phone, in what mirrored a scene from a slasher horror film.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

As the show continued, Holly and Phil looked completely unnerved by the moment, with Holly saying: "Oh my gosh, a bit harsh..."

Phillip was equally as creeped out adding: "A bit sinister isn't it?"

He then told viewers not to be too worried about the scary demand, saying: "I mean you don't have to if you don't want to."

(Image: ITV)

Holly was in hysterics, before she then joked: "Seriously, good luck with that."

The hosts then got back to hosting duties, where they tried some pumpkin carving.

Holly didn't initially get the hang of it, pleading with co-star Phillip to visit her house in the afternoon to help her and her children carve some for Halloween.

This Morning airs weekdays and Sundays at 10:30am on ITV.
description: Love Island star Maura Higgins read out the latest This Morning competition, but the Halloween theme spooked Holly Willoughby
